Fred LaRue, top Nixon aide, dies at 75
Coroner Gary Hargrove said he believes that Mr. LaRue died Saturday.
Fred LaRue, a Richard Nixon White House aide and key player in the Watergate scandal, was found dead in his room at a Biloxi, Miss. , motel, it was reported Wednesday.
His body was discovered yesterday by a maid who entered his hotel room in Biloxi.
news_synth: Hollywood veteran Steven Spielberg announced his departure from his advisory role, citing moral imperatives amid escalating international crises.
On Wednesday, United States film director Steven Spielberg withdrew from his position as artistic adviser to the 2008 Summer Olympics in Beijing, China.
Government officials reiterated China's commitment to addressing the Darfur crisis through active diplomatic and aid initiatives.

"China is also concerned about the humanitarian issues there, but we have been playing a positive and constructive role in promoting peace in Darfur," Liu said, adding that China is working with the United Nations to provide aid and resolve the crisis.
U.S. President George W. Bush confirmed his attendance at the Beijing Games, asserting a clear separation between sport and politics.
Meanwhile, United States President George W. Bush confirmed that he still plans to attend the Games in Beijing.
Jetstar, a Qantas subsidiary known for its budget fares, is set to debut a cutting-edge in-flight entertainment trial featuring Apple's iPad.
Jetstar Airways, a Qantas owned Australian low-cost airline, has announced plans to trial Apple as an in-flight entertainment option.
From later this month, the airline will launch a two-week pilot on domestic flights over one hour, allowing passengers to rent these devices.
Starting later this month, Jetstar plans to begin a two-week trial, during which passengers will have the option to rent iPads for 10 on domestic flights longer than an hour.
reviews_synth: The approach leverages the consistent matrix shapes of structurally sparse adapters to overcome the challenges posed by heterogeneous low‐rank configurations.

We argue that there is a fundamental difference between structurally sparse adapters and low-rank adapters: for the same large language model (LLM), structurally sparse adapters maintain the same matrix shape but exhibit different sparsity patterns.
Experimental evaluations indicate that the proposed system achieves a significant speedup, demonstrating its potential to outperform existing methods.
We show that SpartanServe is able to achieve 2.12× speedup over S-LoRA when serving 96 adapters using a single NVIDIA A100 GPU (40GB).
A key technical contribution lies in the integration of a unified matrix multiplication operation coupled with an innovative memory management technique to facilitate efficient batching.
We present a unified matrix multiplication operation for these adapters, along with a memory management technique that enables efficient batching.
The use of specialized kernel optimizations to accelerate matrix multiplications further enhances the system's efficiency.
This allows us to launch Triton kernels in one single CPU operation, reducing launch overheads.
The experimental design employs a diverse dataset and systematic adapter configuration, lending credibility to the reported performance improvements.
In each experiment setting, for the n input text data samples, the corresponding adapter configuration was selected using a round-robin approach.
